intro: Rhipidoglossum brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rhipidoglossum, is a rare and diminutive flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera, and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments with full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
